intro: Descurainia macbridei, commonly known as the Mexican tansy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Descurainia macbridei is adapted to dry climates and can tolerate moderate drought conditions.
